node.name: [The Star] SJ Care Warriors aim to remove stigma of mental health among youths
node.summary: In her first few months of service, Subang Jaya assemblywoman Michelle Ng found herself attending the funerals of people who had committed suicide.

node.name: [Natural Health] SJ Warriors Against – Mental Health Issues
node.summary: Subang Jaya’s mental health initiative addresses the issue of mental health from a community-based wellness approach focusing on resilience-building.

node.name: [CPPS] Mental illness in Malaysia: the imperative to destigmatise
node.summary: Mental health advocates and professionals agree that one of the biggest obstacles to address mental illness and mental health problems in Malaysia is removing the stigma and dispelling public misconceptions.

node.name: [Mental Health Malaysia] Subang Jaya-based SJ Care Warriors train community to address mental health issues
node.summary: Recognising the severity of mental health issues in Malaysia, a team of medical and non-medical volunteers have joined hands to kick off a mental wellness initiative called SJ Care Warriors.
